text: Somebody just asked for short demos of cool things with Julia on YouTube. Maybe that is something it would be good to have. E.g. I was looking for the trebuchet example but can’t find it

elements.text: Somebody just asked for short demos of cool things with Julia on YouTube. Maybe that is something it would be good to have. E.g. I was looking for the trebuchet example but can’t find it

text: I like the idea! There are of course other types of content that would be possible, not just lectures, for instance live coding.

elements.text: I like the idea! There are of course other types of content that would be possible, not just lectures, for instance live coding.

text:
Yeah I keep remembering this trebuchet example where a NN learns the best way to aim the trebuchet by backpropagating through the diffeq solver (where theres wind). But I can't find it.

Yeah thats a good example of just having all sorts of cool examples

text: Thank you! Thats the example I was thinking of

elements.text: Thank you! Thats the example I was thinking of

text: But it’s not a quick, bite-size example

elements.text: But it’s not a quick, bite-size example

text: Similar to the 7 lines of Julia Discourse post, but as videos

elements.text: Similar to the 7 lines of Julia Discourse post, but as videos

text:
Same! I would love to see that. For me, speed is nice but what really drew me into Julia is the package ecosystem and everything that is possible. For me I think it was Dr. Chris Rackauckas' presentations on SciML that drew me in to look more into Julia, but thats a long video and needs a bit of background on differential equations.

Yeah I love that idea to have short/bite sized videos to see all sorts of capabilities that Julia has

elements.text:

text: I guess the lightning talks at JuliaCon are partly this

elements.text: I guess the lightning talks at JuliaCon are partly this

text: although they are usually aimed at a Julia audience. We need talks aimed at interested people who are curious how Julia shines. cc <@UGR3910CQ>
